Output Module

The output module provides functionality for handling crawler results.

Formatters

formatters.py - Output formatters for crawler results

crawlit.output.formatters.create_output_file(output_path)[source]

Create directory for output file if it doesn’t exist.

Parameters:

output_path (str) – Path to the output file.

crawlit.output.formatters.generate_summary_report(results)[source]

Generate a pretty CLI summary of crawl results

crawlit.output.formatters.save_as_csv(results, output_file, timestamp)[source]

Save crawler results in CSV format

crawlit.output.formatters.save_as_html(results, output_file, timestamp)[source]

Save crawler results in HTML format

crawlit.output.formatters.save_as_json(results, output_file, timestamp, pretty_json=False)[source]

Save crawler results in JSON format

crawlit.output.formatters.save_as_txt(results, output_file, timestamp)[source]

Save crawler results in plain text format

crawlit.output.formatters.save_results(results, output_format=None, output_file=None, pretty_json=False, format_type=None, pretty=None)[source]

Save crawler results to specified file in the requested format.

This function takes the crawler results and saves them to a file in the specified format. It supports JSON, CSV, TXT, and HTML output formats.

Parameters:

  • results (dict) – Crawler results dictionary containing URL data.

  • output_format (str, optional) – Format to save results in (json, csv, txt, html). If None, will use the file extension or default to JSON.

  • output_file (str, optional) – Path to the output file. If None, prints to stdout.

  • pretty_json (bool, optional) – Whether to format JSON with indentation. Defaults to False.

  • format_type (str, optional) – Alternative name for output_format (for backward compatibility).

  • pretty (bool, optional) – Alternative name for pretty_json (for backward compatibility).

Returns:

True if saving was successful, False otherwise.

Return type:

bool

Raises:

ValueError – If an unsupported output format is specified.

pretty: Alternative name for pretty_json (for backward compatibility)
